titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for League of Women Voters of Monroe (Mich.) records, 1959-1963
titlestmt.author: Collection processed and finding aid created by Michigan Historical Collections staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Thomas E. Powers February 2007
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: A Content Standard (DACS)

change.item: Original encoding from Word 2000 file using Word macros and Xmetal.

origination.corpname: League of Women Voters of Monroe (Mich.)

did.unittitle: League of Women Voters of Monroe (Mich.) records 1959-1963
did.abstract: Monroe, Michigan branch of the League of Women Voters; correspondence, reports, and newsletters relating to League activities.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was donated by the League (donor no. 4164) and came to the library in 1964.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, League of Women Voters of Monroe (Mich.) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The League of Women Voters is a nonpartisan, volunteer organization whose purpose is to promote political responsibility through the informed and active participation of citizens in government. The Monroe League chapter was established in 1960.

scopecontent.p: The records of the League of Women Voters of Monroe date from 1959 to 1963, and consist of correspondence, reports, newsletters and printed materials relating to local politics and government
